intro: Erigeron paucifolius, commonly known as the few-leaved fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and prairies. It has a low-growing habit with narrow, gray-green leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Erigeron paucifolius is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
